headline: Swedish Meatballs (Svenska Kottbullar)
description: Swedish meatball recipe made with seasoned ground beef and pork, baked and served with brown sour cream gravy for a family-friendly comfort meal.

video.description: Homemade Swedish meatballs served with a tangy, creamy gravy.
video.name: Swedish Meatballs (Svenska Kottbullar)

name: Swedish Meatballs (Svenska Kottbullar)
recipeIngredient: 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour, or as needed
2 cups beef broth, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Place bread crumbs into a small bowl; mix in cream. Allow to stand until crumbs absorb cream, about 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, melt 1 teaspoon butter in a skillet over medium heat; cook and stir onion until light brown, about 10 minutes. Transfer onion to a mixing bowl.
Mix ground beef, ground pork, egg, brown sugar, salt, black pepper, nutmeg, allspice, and ginger with onion in the mixing bowl. Lightly mix in bread crumbs and cream.

Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Pinch off about 1 1/2 tablespoon meat mixture per meatball; form into balls. Place meatballs into the skillet and cook, turning often, until browned, about 5 minutes. Insides of meatballs will still be pink.
Place browned meatballs into a baking dish, pour in chicken broth, and cover with foil.
Bake in the preheated oven until meatballs are tender, about 40 minutes. Remove meatballs to a serving dish.
Pour pan drippings into a saucepan over medium heat. Whisk flour into drippings until smooth.
Gradually whisk in enough beef broth to total about 2 1/2 cups liquid.
Bring gravy to a simmer, whisking constantly, until thickened, about 5 minutes.
Just before serving, whisk in sour cream. Season with salt and black pepper. Serve gravy with meatballs.

review.reviewBody: This is not a swedish recipe, looks very american. The real recipe has no sour cream, no ginger (not optional at all), no brown sugar (use juniper berry jelly if needed), beef broth or veal broth is used to get the flavor right. Tips: Use soy sauce to get the right color, shred the onion to not get too many big pieces and use heavy cream for the sauce too

Have made this recipe dozens of times with some modifications. I use 1/2 C of plain panko breadcrumbs with the heavy cream and I substitute ground chicken (not ground chicken breast) for the pork/beef. The rest of the ingredients remain as-written (and I always use the Tbsp of brown sugar) and I use closer to a 1/2 C chicken broth than a 1/4 C. The other modification is in the cooking method, I use only a 3 qt saute pan for the dish. I saute the onion in the pan while the breadcrumbs soak up the cream and mix together per the recipe and cook the meatballs in two batches in the pan (makes ~24 meatballs so 12 and 12). Ground chicken tends to flatten out a bit more than red meats so they wind up with flatter edges but nobody seems to mind and nobody has ever said anything to me about that (and they all loved it). Once the second batch is done I throw the first batch back in, add the broth, cover, put into the oven and bake. Once that's done I'll take the pan out of the oven, remove the meatballs and back to the stovetop for the roux. At this point I may use a little more butter as chicken doesn't yield nearly the amount of fat that the beef/pork will. I think the fond in the bottom of the pan from the browning and baking is a key to knocking these out of the park. As long as you didn't burn anything that stuff is pure flavor and with everything cooking in the same pan leaves none of that to waste. For that I'm hesitant to brown the meatballs on a baking sheet to keep them 'rounder'. After I finish the roux, simmering the sauce and adding the sour cream the meatballs return to the pan to warm and simmer in the sauce for a bit. Then the whole thing seems to get devoured with the egg noodles no matter how much I make. Five stars for the inspiration!
What a wonderful dish! I highly recommend it. make sure to make that gravy:)

I grew up with a lot of Swedish cooking. My grandmother used to make Swedish meatballs, then my Mother used her recipe to make them later on. I haven't been able to find a recipe that authentically matched the flavors. My wife used this recipe. One bite and it was like being a kid again! This was a dead on match to what I remember growing up. We're saving this recipe!
Have many several times now, always a HUGE hit! As recommended, I serve with lingonberry preserves. I also serve it with spaetzle, gives it a very European touch. Absolutely delicious!

WONDERFUL and so authentic. I love the simplicity of this recipe and the results were incredible: tender flavorful meatballs, a savory gravy, all atop fluffy, creamy egg noodles. The nutmeg is the star player and transforms the meatballs into an exotic comfort food. I followed the recipe closely but only added a quarter cup sour cream. Take note: The recipe AS IS will really only serve two adults and 2 children. After all, It’s only about a pound of meat, and roughly 30 tiny meatballs. They’re so delectable , you can seriously eat 8 meatballs, maybe more. I recommend getting a pound of pork and a pound of beef, and just doubling the recipe if you are feeding 4-6 adults. it reheats beautifully. I’m eating leftovers today and I swear it’s even better than yesterday. If you like Swedish meatballs, try this recipe. It’s a keeper!

I made this recipe almost exactly as written with two modifications. I didn't have bread, so I used panko breadcrumbs. And, as some other writers suggested, I added a little nutmeg to the gravy at the end. Two aspects of the recipe were a little confusing. One is the amount of sour cream. It says half (8 oz) container sour cream. Does this mean half of an 8 oz container, meaning 4 oz? Or is it a total of 8 oz? My husband and I disagreed on the interpretation, so I went with the 4 oz interpretation and the gravy was superb. If others are using the full 8 oz, I can see why they feel there is too much sour cream. The other aspect that was confusing is whether the pan drippings are coming from the saute skillet or the baking casserole. I used both. In any case, it was a true winner recipe! My husband was totally wowed! Me too.
We loved it! Meatballs came out amazing. I did have to tweak it and sub some items but overall it was great!
This recipe is perfect. If you pay attention, you will see that the chicken broth isn't added to the meatballs, but added to the dish of prepared meatballs to bake in the oven.
not sure why this has received such great reviews. it was ok
I love this recipe, it has become a go to recipe for me. I use plain a 1/2 cup of panko bread crumbs in place of the two slices of day old white bread.
Delicious!! made it several times.over egg noodles.
It was delicious! Can't wait to have the leftovers!
I love this recipe! I won't Swedish meatballs and gravy any other way. Thank you for sharing!
Very delicious. Mouth-watering meatballs.

Very good recipe...the kids devoured it. Only changes I made...tripled the recipe, used only beef (all I had on hand), ran out of beef broth and did half chicken for the gravy, and left out the sour cream (tried it in a small bowl to see if the kids would like it...split decision there so we left it out). Definitely adding this to my recipe journal I keep at the stove!

These meatballs were delicious! So this is what I did and didn't deviate much at all. With my kitchenaid and grinder attachment I ground trimmed bottom round once then added sweet Italian sausage. (3lb beef to 1lb sausage) added my spices then ground again. I had so much that I had to mix the eggs and soaked breadcrumbs with the dough hook. Too much to pan fry so I broild them to crop them up. it made 188 1" meatballs. I used the 24 servings because it doesn't state how many counted as a serving! so I'm guessing it's about 8. I baked 2 dozen as directed then using drippins, beef stock and a pinch of each spice plus sautéed fresh mushrooms I made the gravy. The more you make the more time consuming it is. So what did I do with the rest? I filled 7 pint jars and pressure canned them in the stock. I can then turn it into gravy when we open them up. My husband absolutely loved them for his birthday dinner.
Best meatballs ever!!!! Thank you
Delicious!!!
This was absolutely delicious! Everyone liked them - from the 3 year old to the 46 year old. Will save to be making again for sure.

These are amazing! I will forever make all of my meatballs with this cooking method. I quadrupled the recipe for a crowd using 1 lb of ground pork & 3 lbs of ground beef. Served with egg noodles. I didn’t use sour cream in the gravy, but opted for some heavy cream. I also added a bit of nutmeg & allspice. Absolutely divine!
Great recipe! I left out the sugar but other than that, followed directions.
Absolutely loved cooking it and eating it!! The dish was loved by all who had come over for dinner on my brother's 62nd birthday!!

Delicious. Turned out great. I was a bit intimidated when I saw that there were several steps, but each step is actually easy. The meatballs are extremely soft and tender and yummy, the gravy is perfect. I didn't have any egg noodles, so served them over farfalle pasta, which was the closest I had to flat noodles, and it was totally delicious. My BF grew up with several Swedish friends and used to eat meals over their houses, and he said these taste just like those. You always hear that it's rather challenging to make Swedish meatballs, so I am happy they turned out so great on my first try!
These have incredible flavor! Will definitely be making again, but I may add a bit of nutmeg to the gravy for some added flavor.

This recipe was superb. I loved everything about it. The meatballs were so tender - it’s hard to explain but they were almost ‘fluffy”. I try not to handle or mix the meatballs too much and I think it makes a difference. I loved the gravy too. I think heavy cream would have great results too instead of sour cream as I saw a lot of reviews frowning on the sour cream. I liked it though. I felt the drippings I used in the gravy to be enough for that “beefy” flavor. I have made this recipe twice. Once exactly as is and once with venison and the pork. I was very worried about the venison but it was so good. It took any “gamey” taste right out. Thank you for sharing!

I don’t know what all these other people are talking about but I followed this Recipe with using optional as well this has no taste what so ever. My husband and I will def not have this again I have to actually figure something else out for dinner but it a no go ..
This was really good my husband and 2 year old loved this... I would use a little less sour cream in the gravy but I've added this to my rotation

This was a very warm comforting dish. The meatballs were tender and moist, the sauce was creamy and delicate. We also added egg noodles to ours which just really made for a complete and delicious meal. This was wonderful on a cold day. Would definitely recommend this recipe for ease, taste and as a comfort food.

First time I’ve ever made Swedish meatballs and was very happy with the outcome. A little more work than I’m usually up for, but well worth it. Followed the directions and ingredients exactly as written, including the optional ginger. I might leave out the nutmeg next time as I could taste it but it didn’t ruin the dish. I would have preferred to serve over spaetzel but didn’t have means to make it so served over mashed potatoes. So yummy!

Very tasty, but I think it needed a bit more of the spices. I added some allspice, nutmeg and ginger to the gravy as well, and that did the trick! 

Like others, I went easier on the broth, as well as the sour cream. And since it's what I had, I used only beef broth, not both chicken and beef. 

With spaetzle, it was a real treat! And now we have leftovers!
Delicious!! I made this exactly as written. The meatballs are very soft and have good flavor. Putting this in rotation for the rest of the winter.
It was greasy and didn't really have much flavor.

Absolutely, positively the BEST meatball(s) I have ever eaten!!! I was a little leery at some of the ingredients, BUT, I thought - go big or go home, right? I made the recipe EXACTLY as written, including brown sugar & ginger. What a beautiful mix of seasonings in meatballs that literally melted in my mouth! Thank YOU so much for sharing this recipe, it's going to be a regular at my house.
We love this recipe! It is so good! I always forget to take a picture before we eat it all.

I just cooked the meatballs in the pan on the stove. then when they were done I put them in a bowl and made the gravy in that pan that I cook the meatballs in. Then return the meatballs to the gravy to simmer on low .

Overall, this was a really good recipe. Personally I didn't like the nutmeg, it seemed to overpower the other flavors but was helped by the gravy.

The recipe was solid and easy to make. Everyone enjoyed them. I'd def recommend making this one.
Outstanding recipe and so darn good

These were delicious! A few changes I’ll make next time: use dry breadcrumbs instead of crumbled bread, as I ended up with some soggy lumps in the meatballs. Also, I’ll make them a bit smaller so they’re easier to brown in the frying pan without falling apart!

Made this again but used turkey stock as I didn’t have chicken. Plus I tripled recipe to freeze for my hubby. He enjoyed but the turkey broth not as tasty as chicken broth. We both love these Swedish meatballs .
This seriously was the tastiest Swedish meatball dish I've ever eaten! I used ground venison instead of beefand it paired so well with the sausage. Seriously Sooo Good!! ...a newest favorite for sure
AWESOME, served it over wide egg noodles. Personally the only thing I'm gonna change next time is use 1/2 cup less beef broth. I like my gravy a little tighter. definitely a repeat.

These meatballs were delicious! The combination of seasonings provided great flavor and they were very tender. Perfectly served over Gemelli pasta with tthe gravy. I think they would also be good over Egg noodles!

This was my first foray into Swedish meatballs. They are HEAVEN. I tripled the recipe because I happened to have 2 pounds of ground beef and 1 pound of ground turkey thawed, and I’m so glad I did! The meatballs were so tender and flavorful, and with the gravy they were swoon worthy. I served them with mashed potatoes, and my family ate way too much. The leftovers warm up beautifully too— I nuked the meatballs and warmed the gravy on low in a saucepan. Even after freezing, they were just as good.

These are the best! Based on the reviews I did increase the spices to 1/2t each. Plus added 1/4t nutmeg to the gravy. Uncreditably tender. Don't skip the step to bake meatballs in chicken broth, it intensified the flavor and so tender.

We loved this recipe! I found there wasn’t enough gravy, so I had to double the ingredients. I also pan fried the meatballs & used the drippings to make the gravy. I used an electric frying pan for the meatballs & chicken broth. Instead of the oven. (Have to get my gas oven fixed.) then I added the gravy mixture to the meatballs after some fo the broth evaporated. I added some more nutmeg & allspice to the gravy. I’m going to try making a Swedish stroganoff next.

Prepared this recipe tonight exactly as written and would not change a thing!! My husband gave it 2 thumbs up and said should give it 6 stars! Very tasty with no flavors and/or spices overpowering as some recipes can be.

Meatballs were tender but of the optional spices I’d leave out the brown sugar as we found the meatballs a bit too sweet. We also agree with other reviewers the sour cream sort of took over the taste of the sauce and almost made it too bland. Next batch I’make a meatier flavored gravy supplementing the beef broth with beef base and use cream to keep it balanced and creamy
I made this twice, so far, exactly as recipe states. It came out great and the family loved it. Next time I will try to double the recipe, as there were unfortunately not any leftovers either time.

Love this recipe! I tried it with the real bread crumbles at first, but haven't been patient enough to continue that part so just use packages bread crumbs instead. The mixture comes out very soft which can be tricky when you are browning as they can start to come apart. But the gravy is delicious!!! I find it doesn't require as much sour cream as the recipe calls for, so start with less and add if you want. Sooo good with mashed potatoes. A new favorite.
This was amazing! I doubled the recipe so we had leftovers for lunch the next day. So glad we did. Absolutely delicious. Only thing I did differently was used 2lbs of burger. I did not add any pork.
Excellent recipe. I used all beef and half as much sour cream. Very good. Will definitely make again.
Was very good followed the recipe as written. Next time I make it the spices will be almost doubled. Also I will not add oil to the pan just the butter. To much grease for me.

There are definitely a lot of steps to this recipe, but it is totally worth it! My grandpa made Swedish meatballs with mashed potatoes growing up and it has been my favorite meal. This recipe is very close to how his tasted. I used mild Italian sausage in place of the ground pork.?? completely forgot to add the sour cream to the gravy at the end – but it was amazing so maybe you don’t need it?? I doubled the batch so I can freeze for another meal.
I will make this again with some adjustments to the recipe. I didn’t care for the sweetness of the meatballs.The sauce is missing the “zing” I recall from the restaurant flavor.
Wonderful, I was out of nutmeg, but leaving that out didn’t effect it much. When I make again will use nutmeg and see if that enhances rage already great flavor.

I used ground turkey. I also only had wheat bread :) The meatball recipe is really good and the meat was super tender. Soaking the bread is key. I felt the gravy was a little bland so I added crushed red pepper, garlic salt and more black pepper. Once I added the sour cream, I added the baked meatballs to the sauce along with sliced fresh mushrooms. I let everything simmer together for about 15 minutes. Served over egg noodles. Delicious!! Next time, I will use the pork and beef as I'm sure it's superb.

I used ground turkey. I also only had wheat bread :) The meatball recipe is really good and the meat was super tender. Soaking the bread is key. I felt the gravy was a little bland so I added crushed red pepper, garlic salt and more black pepper. Once I added the sour cream, I added the baked meatballs to the sauce along with sliced fresh mushrooms. I let everything simmer together for about 15 minutes. Served over egg noodles. Delicious!! Next time, I will use the pork and beef as I'm sure it's superb.

I didn't take a photo but will next time! This recipe is a keeper, tasted exactly as I hoped it would. I prepped and cooked the day before then reheated all together in a crockpot the next day and it was awesome! Served Labor Day Weekend with a bbq and the gravy was sooooo good we put it on our pork chops as well. There were no left-overs so my hubby wants me to make them again later this week. The only ingredient I didn't have was ginger but it wasn't missed at all. Thank you so much for sharing this scrumptious recipe!

OMG soooo delicious! I made 3 lbs worth of meat (2 lbs beef, 1 lb pork), and tripled everything else, except when it came to making the beef broth gravy, I only added enough beef broth little by little to get the perfect saucy consistency (to make sure it didn't get too watery). Cooked the meatballs in 2 pans to speed up cooking
i did not use the chix juice, just beef
I doubled the recipe for a lot of people and made a roux before introducing the broth. It was excellent!
Made this exactly as written, including the gravy. Delicious!! Thanks for the great recipe!

This recipe was amazing!!!! After reading the reviews I also followed the recipe regarding soaking the breadcrumbs in cream and using all the spices. I upped the serving size to 10 to equal my meat weight because I used 1 lb ground beef and 1 lb ground pork (2# total) and to get correct ratios for all the ingredients and spices. I followed the instructions, kept all the spices the same and used all of them, even the ginger, seared the meatballs in a pan with butter and put in a baking dish. I used beef stock instead of chicken stock for the baking dish and baked as directed 30 minutes with foil and that was the perfect time. I used the drippings from the fry pan in addition to the drippings from the bake pan and made a wonderful gravy with the remaining beef stock. I used half of the amount of sour cream recommend based on my serving size of 10, which ended up being about 4 oz because like past reviews we liked a meatier gravy. I added a little bit of fresh chopped parsley to the gravy and served with egg noodles. My husband and my kids loved this meal and my husband actually said I could serve it at a dinner party! we will definitely be making this one again!!!! Thanks NomNom!

My family thought this was quite good. I thought it was slightly overrated, possibly because I used all hamburger (since that's what I had). I omitted the brown sugar and used slightly less sour cream. I had more than a pound of hamburger to use, so I increased the other ingredients accordingly. 

The downside is that it was time-consuming to make, brown, and bake so many meatballs. Luckily my son was available to help. Even so, I was tempted to simply scramble and fry the meat mixture and then stir in the gravy. I may do that next time for a much faster meal prep. It wouldn't be Swedish meatballs, of course, but the flavor would be about the same.
Just used this recipe for the first time. It's the best one of Swedish meatballs I've used! Very tasty.
Fabulous! The seasoning mix was perfect! This is definitely my new go to version. Thanks for sharing!!
This was excellent. Highly recommend it

This was amazing!!!!!! I kept true to the recipe and it was wonderful. Mincing the onion and using small bread pieces is helpful. After making the meat mixture I had to leave for about an hour so I refrigerated it. That might have helped the meatballs stay together when browning. Served with extra wide egg noodles and lingonberries. My son (24) ate seconds! Reminded me of the Swedish meatballs my Mom always made on Christmas Eve. Will definitely make again!!!!!

Very good! I used 1 lb of ground beef because that's all I had on hand. I didn't have allspice, so I just added a tiny bit of nutmeg and cinnamon to the meat mixture. I also added a couple of drops of Worcestershire sauce to the sauce and only used one big scoop of sour cream. Everything else stayed the same. I didn't use "day old" bread because I forgot to leave it out, so the meatballs were very wet and the cooked meatballs were incredibly soft. However, my son actually liked the extra soft meatballs. But next time, I will toast the bread slightly. Overall, a very tasty and different dish from what we're used to. Thanks for sharing!
I used mushroom broth. Accidentally baked the meatballs in the broth but was able to thicken the gravy by making a butter and flour roux and adding the broth back in. Turned out great.

Delightful recipe. It's interesting to read that Americans don't like baking spices in meals. As one, I'm interested in anything that tastes good. This was good. Well, is- I am finishing up now. I'm adding it to the book. Thanks

This is super delicious. I really didn't know what to expect using nutmeg and allspice but it turned out amazing. I doubled the recipe and used a pound of deer burger and a pound of sweet Italian sausage. Amazing. Will absolutely make again. Thank you!!
It was really bland.

Delicious! I made the meatballs ahead of time to speed up the process. The flavor was fantastic. I served them over noodles. The only bad thing I can say is I wish I had doubled the recipe so we could eat leftovers.

I was a little ambivalent about all the spices, but they were wonderful. I did not change one thing. These will always be my meatballs now. Today I am going to make the recipe into a meatloaf. Husband liked it as well. I'm not a fan of Allspice nor Nutmeg, but this is awesome.
Absolutely delicious! Made this twice and it was a huge hit! Served it with butter noodles. Yum will make again.
I followed the recipe directly and my husband loved it and so did the rest of my family and I will make it again.

I added 1/3 more nutmeg and allspice just because I love the taste. These were so tender and the gravy was perfectly flavourful without taking attention awy from the taste of the meatballs. The family loved and and told me I need to make it again

This recipe is fantastic. I don't soak the bread crumbs in the heavy cream because that resulted in bunches of bread crumbs in the meatballs. Instead I mix everything together. These are time consuming. I usually make a double batch of the meatballs and freeze half. When I'm ready to use the frozen meatballs I make fresh sauce.

Great recipe-made w/ground turkey and used milk instead of cream. The nutmeg was too strong for me and I omitted the allspice but added the ginger. Very tender only needed 23 minutes in oven. Next time I’ll make with with modifications - keeper!
The Seniors that I cook for seemed to Love them. Thanks

I actually froze the meatballs for later use. When I pulled them out of the freezer and tried to brown them in the saucepan they started to fall apart. So instead I put them in the oven as stated and just cooked them 1 hr instead of 45 minutes. Then I put them over pkgd egg noodles. Delicious!
Very good recipe. It needs salt, but really delicious and easy to make.

I just made this tonight and it was great! 
Even more importantly our tween kids ate it all too!

My family, hard-to-please hubby plus two twenty-something sons, LOVED these Swedish meatballs as our dinner tonight! The only change I made was eliminating the onion; all else remained as stated. (I know I’ll make them again soon.)
it was great!
This recipe was amazing! the whole process took about 2 hrs start to finish. And, like another review stated, I would use a little less sour cream in the gravy the next time. Otherwise delicious!!!

This was a pretty good...unusual to cook swedish meatballs (not svenska kottbullar, but svensk köttbullar - "svenska" means Swedish language; kött, or koett, is "meat" and bullar is "balls") in chicken broth, so I ommitted this step and just baked them. Also replaced the cream with milk for making the meatballs. Otherwise quite decent! Not sure if I will make it again except for special occasions since the meat itself costs more than a kg of pre-made ones at the store here haha.
Substituted plain yoghurt for sour cream. Quite yummy
I would use more beef broth than two cups. It's better to have extra liquid as it is absorbed by the noodles. Other than that, it was great. I love the spices and would probably add more next time.

About a year ago, I made this exactly as written, but had to purchase the meats since we are hunters and usually only have venison present. This recipe was so delicious that I had to try it with venison, so the second time around, I used 2lbs of venison and replaced the cream with buttermilk (this eliminates any "gamey" taste from the venison). This recipe came out even better with the venison and buttermilk, in my family's opinion. I've read the reviews that say they would use less sour cream, but honestly, some of us loved that sour cream taste and some of us would have preferred it with a little less.... so it is really a personal taste kind of thing. I'm making this again tonight and plan to put sour cream on the table and allow people to add however much they prefer ;)
Just fixed these great tasting meatballs. My family loved them! Will be a family favorite.

So good! Read the reviews before hand and used less sour cream in the end and it turned out amazing. Didn’t use ginger, as I didn’t have any and I used ground turkey meat instead. I can only compare them to IKEA meatballs and those pre-package seasonings at the store, but honestly, these are by far the best Swedish Meatballs I’ve ever had! Definitely adding this to my recipes to use again and again! I put them over Amish Egg noodles which were good, but I think I’d like this better with mashed potatoes, so next time we’ll try that route. Great Recipe!
This was delicious!Det var jättegott! Served with lingonberry jam and mashed potatoes
Great flavor, not overpowering!
Follow the directions exactly it is amazing?
I think I used the wrong kind of bread because I wasn’t able to make meatballs. It was more like clumps of tasty ground meat.. but the flavor was amazing and I’ll be making this again!
This was the best Swedish Meatballs I have ever had! My family absolutely loves them!
